result.execSummary:
The defendant Quinton Monroe Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision on Count 2, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges WAIVED.

Concurrent with: with credit for 130 DAYS time served, to be served at the Wisconsin State Prison with Count 2. This sentence is concurrent to counts 2 & 6, but consecutive to all other sentences, and is to be served as straight time.

Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Concurrent with: with credit for 130 DAYS time served. This sentence is concurrent to counts 1 & 6, but consecutive to all other sentences.

No contact with firearms/dangerous weapons.
Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
No VIOLENT contact with victim Cheryl T. or Ashley M.

Batterers Intervention program.
Parenting classes.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
WAVIED DNA Sample, previously provided.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Quinton Monroe Harris in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Quinton Monroe Harris in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst for Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for continued Sentencing Hearing. Victim addressed the court as to sentencing. Statements from Defendant. Sentencing proceeded. 
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 4 MONTHS of incarceration, with credit for 130 DAYS time served, to be served at the Wisconsin State Prison with Count 2. This sentence is concurrent to counts 2 & 6, but consecutive to all other sentences, and is to be served as straight time. Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision on Count 2, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges WAIVED.

AS TO COUNT 6
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS of incarceration, with credit for 130 DAYS time served, to be served at the Wisconsin State Prison with Count 2. This sentence is concurrent to counts 1 & 2, but consecutive to all other sentences, and is to be served as straight time. Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision on Count 2, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges WAIVED.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 6 YEARS, with credit for 130 DAYS time served. This sentence is concurrent to counts 1 & 6, but consecutive to all other sentences, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 3 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No VIOLENT contact with victim Cheryl T. or Ashley M.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain HSED.
-No contact with firearms/dangerous weapons
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-WAVIED DNA Sample, previously provided.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Quinton Monroe Harris NOT in court, in custody. Attorney James Edgar Toran and ADA Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Sentencing Hearing on 7/24/2015. Due to family emergency, matter is adjourned for Sentencing to 7/27/2015. Court Vacated the 7/24/2015 Sentencing date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Quinton Monroe Harris in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Quinton Monroe Harris in custody.  Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded. Court reviewed and returned photographs to the state. Statements by State and Defense counsel. Due to the lateness of the hour court is adjourned to branch 23 for continued sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Quinton Monroe Harris in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Quinton Monroe Harris in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 2nd call of Jury Trail. Parties ready to proceed. State advised court that the state's witnesses have absconded from the hallway upon seeing the defendant being brought into court. State requested a Body Attachment for witnesses. Witnesses reappeared in court, state no longer requesting Body Attachment. At the request of the state, the Court ordered state's witnesses into the jury box (Ashley M. & Cheryl T.). Court held colloquy with witnesses and advised them they must appear and comply with court's orders. Court placed rulings on the record. Witnesses ordered sequestered. District Attorney's Office Victim/Witness Advocate Jasmine Brisby appeared on the record. Motion issues and pretrial issues discussed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution of this matter. 
AS TO COUNTS 3, 4 & 5
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered counts 3, 4 & 5 Dismissed, But Read In. 
AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 & 6
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored, and provide a DNA sample. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing to 6/25/2015 at 1:30 PM.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Court granted defense request for contact while in custody.

Defendant Quinton Monroe Harris NOT in court, in custody. In court attorney James Edgar Toran.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. 1st call, parties ready to proceed. Case passed to address Court Calendar.

Defendant Quinton Monroe Harris in court with attorney Lauren Blumenthal James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Quinton Monroe Harris in custody.  Nicholas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. Attorney Blumenthal advised court that Attorney Toran unable to appear due to scheduling conflict in Sheboygan county. Discussion regarding adjournment and speedy trial demand. Court set case for a Jury Trial within the speedy trial demand time limit in branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed.
State's Amended Witness List received and filed.
Received & Filed, Notice of State's Intent to Use DNA Evidence, Notice of Expert Testimony, and State's Witness List.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Quinton Monroe Harris in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Quinton Monroe Harris in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Court ordered all motions filed and discovery turned over 20 DAYS prior to Jury Trial. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.M., C.T., R.T., and D.L.

The Court ordered no possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters Not Guilty pleas as to Misdemeanor Counts 1, 5, and 6.

Defendant Quinton Monroe Harris in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Quinton Monroe Harris in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Flanagan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grady, Br. 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
